citations.narrative:
The facility has not developed a complete written plan to provide humane care for handling animals in the event of an
emergency or disaster. The lack of an adequate contingency plan could increase the risk of not being able to safeguard
animals during emergencies or disasters. The facility must develop, document and follow an appropriate plan to provide
for the humane handling, treatment, transportation, housing and care of their animals in the event of an emergency or
disaster that could reasonably be anticipated for the species at the site. The plan shall address specific tasks required to
be carried out in response to the identified emergencies, personnel responsible for the actions to be taken, chain of
command, etc., as required in Section 2.38 (l) of the animal welfare regulations. To be corrected by: July 24, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.38(l) 
   
Miscellaneous. 
The facility has not developed a complete written plan to provide humane care for handling animals in the event of an 
emergency or disaster. The lack of an adequate contingency plan could increase the risk of not being able to safeguard 
animals during emergencies or disasters. The facility must develop, document and follow an appropriate plan to provide 
for the humane handling, treatment, transportation, housing and care of their animals in the event of an emergency or 
disaster that could reasonably be anticipated for the species at the site. The plan shall address specific tasks required to 
be carried out in response to the identified emergencies, personnel responsible for the actions to be taken, chain of 
command, etc., as required in Section 2.38 (l) of the animal welfare regulations. To be corrected by: July 24, 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
